contentList.content: You worship no god, or do not consider yourself to be strongly bound to any particular belief.
Select an additional personality type. Personality type affect your available dialogue choices.
You have no additional personality beyond the obvious.
You are impulsive, direct, and prone to explosive bouts of rage.
You are charming and persuasive, always ready with a timely quip.
You are steadfast in your faith, guided by conviction, and interpret events through a spiritual lens.
You are in tune with the rhythms of nature, seeing the world through cycles of growth and decay.
You are unshakable, determined to see things through no matter the odds.
Calm by nature, you search for inner order even in the most chaotic moments.
You are perceptive and cautious, always assessing situations with clear, practical judgment.
You are clever and sly, always fishing for opportunities hidden between the lines.
You are emotionally volatile, your personality shaped by the raw power that courses through you.
Your motivations are shaped, subtly or overtly, by promises or deals you’ve made in the past.
You are analytical to the point of obsession, dissecting problems in pursuit of deeper truths.
Select an additional character trait. Character traits provide alternate ways to craft your character, and may provide both positive or negative effects.
You have no additional character traits.

While below 50% of your maximum <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag>, you gain a +2 bonus to all damage dealt. However, while above 50% of your maximum Hit Points, you receive a -2 penalty instead.
You permanently benefit from the effects of being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CALM_EMOTIONS">Calmed</LSTag>. However, your targeting range is limited to [1].

Gain a bonus to damage dealt equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>. However, when dealing damage, you take damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus multiplied by two.

At the beginning of any combat encounter, you receive <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">Temporary Hit Points</LSTag> equal to your level multiplied by two. Upon ending combat, you take Force damage equal to your level multiplied by four.

Gain the ability to center yourself with a deep breath, restoring your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ActionPoint">Action</LSTag>. At the end of your turn, you immediately fall <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="UNCONSCIOUS">Unconscious</LSTag>, causing you to lose your next turn.

Center yourself with a deep breath, restoring your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ActionPoint">Action</LSTag>. At the end of your turn, you will immediately fall <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="UNCONSCIOUS">Unconscious</LSTag>, causing you to lose your next turn.
Upon casting a Spell, there is a 10% chance that it will erupt in a violent explosion, damaging everything within [1] of your target.
Reduce the number needed to roll a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> by 2. However, the damage of your Critical Hits is permanently halved.
Upon being damaged while not enraged, you immediately fall <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag> and begin to cry. Upon starting your next turn, you become enraged for three turns.
Affected creature is crying. Upon expiration of this status, they will throw a tantrum and become enraged for three turns!

Gain <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Necrotic damage and status immunity to Fear-based effects. However, you also become <LSTag Tooltip="Vulnerable">Vulnerable</LSTag> to Radiant damage.
Upon starting your turn in combat, you have a 10% chance to only roll <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hits</LSTag>. However, you also have a 10% chance to lose your turn entirely.
Affected creature will only roll <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hits</LSTag> until the end of their current turn.
Affected creature is paralyzed, unable to act. Attacks made against them will always result in a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag>.
You are permanently <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ENLARGE_BARBARIAN">Enlarged</LSTag>. However, rather than having your damage increased by [1], it is instead reduced.
When dealing damage, you deal an additional point of damage for every 100 gold pieces your target has in their inventory, consuming them in the process.

Gain an additional <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ActionPoint">Action</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag>. However, you also receive a -10 penalty to your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag>, your maximum <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag> are halved, and you make all <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.
Upon killing an enemy with a melee-based <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, everything within [1] of them will receive [2].

Gain an additional <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reaction</LSTag>. When making an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> which uses a Reaction, you roll with <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.
Gain a +5 bonus to all <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>. However, you are unable to roll <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hits</LSTag>.

When being healed, you always recover the maximum amount of <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag> possible. However, upon being healed, you also become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHILL_TOUCH">Bone Chilled</LSTag> for three turns.

Melee-based <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> will never deal less than 8 damage. However, you make all melee-based <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.

You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on all <LSTag Tooltip="Concentration">Concentration</LSTag> based <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>. However, upon starting your turn while not Concentrating, you have a 10% chance to become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STUNNED">Stunned</LSTag> and lose your turn.
You are considered to be a Construct, and as such, gain status based immunity to a number of conditions. However, during combat, you cannot be healed.
You are unable to be forcibly moved or fall <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>. However, you have a -10 penalty to your Initiative.

Gain the ability to make an off-hand weapon attack as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag>, and all off-hand based <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> are rolled with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>. However, all Attack Rolls made with your main-hand are rolled with <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.

Reduce the number needed to roll a Critical Hit by 4, and your Hit Points are doubled. However, you are unable to utilize Attunement.

Warning: Starting your turn or combat while utilizing your Attunement will instantly kill you.

While traveling with just one other companion, you gain an additional Action, Bonus Action, Reaction, your maximum Hit Points are doubled, and you gain 12 additional points of Attunement.

While traveling completely alone, you gain three additional Actions, Bonus Actions, Reactions, your Hit Points are quadrupled, and you gain 24 additional points of Attunement.

Upon starting your turn, you have a 33% chance to fall <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SLEEP">Asleep</LSTag>. Upon waking from a sleep-based Condition, you receive <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">Temporary Hit Points</LSTag> equal to your level multiplied by 4.

Permanently gain the effects of <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DetectThoughts">Detect Thoughts</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_SpeakWithAnimals">Speak with Animals</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_SpeakWithDead">Speak with Dead</LSTag>. However, you make all Charisma-based <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.

When dealing damage with Spells, you deal additional damage equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>. However, you also have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on all Constitution-based <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.

Spells you cast increase their <LSTag Tooltip="DifficultyClass">Difficulty Class</LSTag> by two. However, you make all <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.
Double your <LSTag Tooltip="CarryWeight">Carrying Capacity</LSTag>. However, each turn you have a 5% chance to become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="OFF_BALANCED">Off Balanced</LSTag>.

Each turn, you may teleport up to [1] as a free action. However, you also have a 33% chance upon doing so to be suddenly <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BANISHED_SPELL">Banished</LSTag> when doing so, and your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag> is reduced by [2].
Teleport up to [1] as a free action. However, you also have a 33% chance to be suddenly <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BANISHED_SPELL">Banished</LSTag>.

You no longer provoke <LSTag Tooltip="OpportunityAttack">Opportunity Attacks</LSTag>. However, you are unable to utilize your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reactions</LSTag> during combat.

Gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on all <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and damage rolls. However, you also become <LSTag Tooltip="Vulnerable">Vulnerable</LSTag> to all damage.

Your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag> is halved. However, upon damaging an enemy with a melee-based <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, you halve their Movement Speed as well.
Affected creature's <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag> is halved.

You gain status-based immunity to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BIBBERBANG_FUMES">Noxious Fumes</LSTag>. However, while moving you will create a [1] cloud of Noxious Gas and you make all Charisma-based <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.
Gain the ability to target two enemies at once with your weapon-based <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>. However, all weapon-based Attack Rolls also deal half damage.

While in an obscured area, you gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on all <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>. However, while unobscured, you roll with <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> instead.
Affected creature has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on all <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>.
Affected creature has <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on all <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>.

While in combat, killing another creature will immediately restore [1]. However, if you fail to kill a creature within three turns, you become permanently <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MADNESS">Mad</LSTag> until you do.

Affected creature is slowly being driven to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MADNESS">Madness</LSTag>. Should they fail to land a killing blow before this condition expires, they will become permanently Mad until they do.

Each turn in combat, you have a 10% chance to experience a positive surge of <LSTag Tooltip="WildMagic">Wild Magic</LSTag>. However, upon recovering from being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DOWNED">Downed</LSTag>, you have a 100% chance to experience a negative surge.

Your maximum <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag> are doubled. However, each time that you go down, your maximum Hit Points are permanently reduced by 4. This reduction in Hit Points cannot be undone.
Your maximum <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag> have been reduced by 4 per stack of this condition. This reduction in Hit Points cannot be undone.

You make all Attack Rolls, Ability Checks, and Saving Throws with Disadvantage.

Warning: Taking this trait will drastically impact intended game balance.
Actions are your primary resource in combat.
Bonus Actions are your secondary resource in combat.
Reactions are responses you can have to events which can trigger both during and outside of your turn.

While enabled, this character will not participate in combat encounters. All non-participants vanish at the beginning of combat, only reappearing once combat has ended.

Should all other party memberes flee combat, this character will have three turns to leave combat as well. After three turns, if they are still in combat, they will immediately die.

If all members of the party have either been defeated or are non-participants, the game will immediately end.

While enabled, this character will not initially participate in combat encounters. All non-participants vanish at the beginning of combat, only reappearing once combat has ended.

Once all allied active combatants have been killed, Downed, have fled combat, or are under the effects of Aether Suspension, this character will rejoin the combat encounter.
Affected creature will not participate in this combat encounter.

Affected creature will not participate in this combat encounter until all allied active combatants have been killed, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DOWNED">Downed</LSTag>, have fled combat, or are under the effects of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BANISHED">Aether Suspension</LSTag>.
Affected creature is the last line of defense! It's now or never!
Affected creature is unable to act, and will remain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DOWNED">Downed</LSTag> until the end of the current combat encounter.
Affected creature will die if combat has not ended when this condition expires.
Monk: Way of the Drunken Fist
Monk: Way of the Open Hand
Monk: Way of the Shadow Arts
Paladin: Oath of the Crowned Phoenix

Through magic, you convey your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Bard_Perform_Whistle">Performances</LSTag> without making a sound, halving their area of effect but allowing you to act freely. While performing, you may also toggle this on in order to end your Performance.

All conditions and debilitations which utilize <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> are considered to either be physical or mental. Applying a physical condition always utilizes the highest of either your Strength or Dexterity when calculating your <LSTag Tooltip="DifficultyClass">Difficulty Class</LSTag>. When applying a mental condition, this class utilizes this ability to calculate your Difficulty Class.
Knock someone <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="UNCONSCIOUS">Unconscious</LSTag> instead of killing them. No effect on Undead or Constructs. This can be toggled at any time.

With nothing equipped in your
off-hand equipment slots, gain an additional Action once every three turns. In addition, you gain a +2
bonus to Attack Rolls and your Initiative, as well as the ability to make an Unarmed Strike using your Bonus Action.

Affected creature will gain an additional <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ActionPoint">Action</LSTag> upon reaching three stacks of this condition. This condition is immediately removed if in a state in which Free Handling charges cannot be accrued.

Affected creature has gained an additional <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ActionPoint">Action</LSTag> this turn. This condition is immediately removed if in a state in which Free Handling charges cannot be accrued.

Once per turn, upon expending an Action, you will generate one stack of Free Handling: Action. This can be toggled at any time.

Upon generating three stacks, you will immediately receive an additional Action until the end of your turn.

In addition, you gain a +2 bonus to Attack Rolls and your Initiative. This can be toggled at any time.

Affected creature will gain an additional <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag> upon reaching three stacks of this condition. This condition is immediately removed if in a state in which Free Handling charges cannot be accrued.

Affected creature has gained an additional <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag> this turn. This condition is immediately removed if in a state in which Free Handling charges cannot be accrued.

Once per turn, upon expending an Bonus Action, you will generate one stack of Free Handling: Bonus Action. This can be toggled at any time.

Upon generating three stacks, you will immediately receive an additional Bonus Action until the end of your turn.

In addition, you gain a +2 bonus to Attack Rolls and your Initiative. This can be toggled at any time.

While <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SNEAKING">Sneaking</LSTag>, make a basic <LSTag Tooltip="RangedWeaponAttack">Ranged Weapon Attacks</LSTag>.
Cantrips are weaker than Spells, though they do not consume <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slots</LSTag> when cast.
<LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reactions</LSTag> which act as offensive counter actions utilize this resource in order to function properly.

Spells are stronger than Cantrips, though they require Spell Slots in order to cast.

You may select any Spell at levels 3, 7, and 11.

Cantrips are weaker than Spells, though they do not consume Spell Slots when cast.

As a Bard, you may select any Cantrip.

Spells are stronger than Cantrips, though they require Spell Slots in order to cast.

As a Bard, you may select any Spell.

Cantrips are weaker than Spells, though they do not consume Spell Slots when cast.

Under the Way of the Arcane, you may select any Cantrip.

Spells are stronger than Cantrips, though they require Spell Slots in order to cast.

Under the Way of the Arcane, you may select any Spell.
You add your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> with all weapons.

Used to gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>, or force enemies to attack you with <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>. Landing a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> or killing blow will restore one Duellist Charge.
Make a melee attack with your main-hand weapon.
Make a ranged attack with your main-hand weapon.
Make a melee attack with your off-hand weapon.
Make a ranged attack with your off-hand weapon.
Make a melee attack with both of your melee weapons.
Make a ranged attack with both of your ranged weapons.

Choose additional spells from the list below. Spells within this list change depending on your choice of subclass. Spells require <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slots</LSTag> to cast, unless a feature states otherwise.

Muscles and physical power. Improves your accuracy and damage with <LSTag Tooltip="MeleeWeaponAttack">Melee</LSTag> weapons. Also applies an additional global bonus to all physical Melee damage dealt when you have no weapon in your off-hand, along with improving how far you can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_Jump">Jump</LSTag> and how much you can <LSTag Tooltip="CarryWeight">Carry</LSTag>.

Agility and balance. Improves your accuracy and damage with <LSTag Tooltip="RangedWeaponAttack">Ranged</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Finesse">Finesse</LSTag> weapons. Also improves your Initiative, and <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> when wearing Clothing, Light Armour, or Medium Armour.
Stamina and physical endurance. Increases the amount of <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag> you gain per level and reduces physical damage taken when wearing Medium or Heavy Armour.
Astuteness and memory. Improves <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbilityModifier">Spellcasting</LSTag> for Rogues and Wizards, as well as their ability to apply Conditions.
Sense and intuition. Improves <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbilityModifier">Spellcasting</LSTag> for Clerics, Druids, Monks, and Rangers, as well as their ability to apply Conditions.

Fortitude and resilience. Improves <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbilityModifier">Spellcasting</LSTag> for Barbarians, Bards, Fighters, Paladins, Sorcerers, and Warlocks, as well as their ability to apply Conditions.

While wearing Medium or Heavy Armour, physical damage suffered due to a Melee or Ranged <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, or due to a Spell, is reduced by an amount equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Constitution Modifier</LSTag>.

Armour Class bonus from Dexterity limited to +2.
Damage Reduction from Constitution limited to -2.

Armour Class is unaffected by your Dexterity.
Damage Reduction from Constitution has no limit.

When you are about to receive physical damage due to a Melee or Ranged <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, or due to a Spell, you utilize your armour to lessen the blow and reduce the damage. Damage is reduced by a value equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Constitution Modifier</LSTag>.
Once per turn, after having made an unarmed or weapon based <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, you may make an additional attack for free.

Gain an additional Action at all times.

This passive acts as a replacement of Extra Attack.

Once per turn, after having made an unarmed or weapon based Attack Roll, or after having cast a Spell, you may make an additional attack for free.

This passive acts as a replacement of Extra Attack.
While assuming the form of a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag>, you gain an additional <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ActionPoint">Action</LSTag>.

Ends the day and restores all <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag> and resources.
To take a Long Rest, go to camp and use <LSTag Tooltip="CampSupplies">Camp Supplies</LSTag>. If you don't have enough Camp Supplies, you will not regain any resources.

Use the campfire button to go to camp, restoring <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slots</LSTag>.
Fully resting requires <LSTag Tooltip="CampSupplies">Camp Supplies</LSTag>. If you don't have enough supplies, you will not regain any resources.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> Warning: You will not regain any resources.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> Warning: You will not regain any resources.
When damaged by a melee based <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>, your aggressor takes [1].
